channel.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India
channel.description: TOI delivers the Top Latest World news and Headlines from US, UK, Gulf, Pakistan, China, Europe and rest of the world.

image.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India

item.title: Obama offers pregnant Chelsea Clinton his motorcade
item.description: US President Barack Obama offered heavily pregnant Chelsea Clinton his motorcade on Tuesday, in case she needed to speed through New York city gridlock to give birth.

item.title: 2 wounded in central Florida mall shooting
item.description: Authorities say two people have been wounded in a shooting at a central Florida mall, and police are trying to determine if two men found dead a short time later in a crashed vehicle are connected.

item.title: Vatican arrests former archbishop on paedophilia charges
item.description: The Vatican on Tuesday arrested a former archbishop accused of paying for sex with children while he was a papal ambassador in the Dominican Republic, the first-ever arrest inside the city state on charges of paedophilia.

item.title: US agency estimates Ebola could infect 1.4m by Jan
item.description: Yet another set of ominous projections about the Ebola epidemic in West Africa was released on Tuesday, in a report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention that gave worst- and best-case estimates for Liberia and Sierra Leone based on computer modelling.

item.title: This is not just America’s fight alone, says Obama
item.description: The US opened a new front in its wars in the Middle East, launching air strikes against Sunni militants in Syria and complicating the situation in a region already fraught with tensions.

item.title: Bin Laden son-in-law sentenced to life in US prison
item.description: A seemingly unrepentant Suleiman Abu Ghaith, a son-in-law of Osama bin Laden, was sentenced to life in prison on Tuesday in New York following his conviction on terrorism charges.

item.title: Terror suspect shot dead in Melbourne
item.description: A man was shot dead and two counterterrorism policemen were stabbed in a confrontation in Australia's second largest city on Tuesday, police said.

item.title: Ebola toll climbs to 2,811 out of 5,864 cases: WHO
item.description: The deadliest Ebola epidemic on record has now infected almost 6,000 people in west Africa and killed nearly half of them, according to the World Health Organization's latest figures.

item.title: Yemen leader warns of 'civil war' as rebels control capital
item.description: President Abdrabuh Mansur Hadi warned Tuesday of "civil war" in Sunni-majority Yemen and vowed to restore state authority as Shia rebels appeared to be in near-total control of the capital.

item.title: 2nd video of British hostage John Cantlie released
item.description: The Islamic State militants have released a second video of British journalist John Cantlie in less than a week which shows him warning US-led coalition against carrying out military operations against his captors.

item.title: Israeli troops kill Hamas men blamed for slaying teens: Army
item.description: Israeli troops on Tuesday killed two Palestinians blamed for abducting and killing three Israeli youths in the occupied West Bank in June, the military said, an incident that spiralled into a seven-week war in Gaza.

item.title: China jails Uighur scholar Ilham Tohti for life for 'separatism'
item.description: Ilham Tohti was known as a moderate voice who spoke out about the plight of Uighurs under majority Han Chinese rule.

item.title: Yemeni Shia rebels sweep into Sanaa, 340 dead
item.description: Mansour Hayel, a Yemeni political analyst, compared the Hawthi sweep to the rampage in Iraq and Syria by Sunni militants from the Islamic State group.

item.title: Jury finds bank liable for backing Hamas-related terrorism
item.description: The defence argued there was no evidence Arab Bank executives supported terrorism and rubbished the allegation that the institution knowingly made payments to designated terrorists.

item.title: IS-linked group ‘threatens to kill’ French hostage in Algeria
item.description: The jihadists are now advancing on a key border town in northern Syria, sending 130,000 terrified residents fleeing to Turkey.

item.title: White House intruder had ammo in car: Report
item.description: The secret service didn't open fire on Gonzalez or send attack dogs after him.

item.title: Ebola kills 2,811, outbreak ‘contained’ in Nigeria: WHO
item.description: At the same time "the outbreaks in Senegal and Nigeria are pretty much contained," the WHO said in a statement.

item.title: Frenchman kidnapped in Algeria: Report
item.description: News of the abduction came after the radical Islamic State group called on Muslims to kill citizens of countries taking part in the US-led anti-jihadist coalition in Iraq, which includes France.

item.title: Yemen fighting killed at least 200 within week: Govt
item.description: At least 200 people were killed on the outskirts of the Yemeni capital in fighting during the past week between Shia rebels and Sunni militiamen, the government said on Monday.

item.title: UK PM tries to quell party revolt over new powers for Scotland
item.description: British Prime Minister David Cameron tried to head off a rebellion in his Conservative party over a promise of new powers for Scotland, highlighting the difficulty of giving Scots what they want after last week's referendum on Scottish independence.

item.title: Some 130,000 Syrians reach Turkey, fleeing IS
item.description: Some 130,000 Syrian refugees fleeing the advance of Islamic State militants have crossed the border into Turkey in the past four days, Turkey's deputy prime minister said on Monday, warning that the number could rise further as the militants continue their onslaught.

item.title: US TV reporter quits on air to promote marijuana
item.description: A reporter for an Alaska TV station revealed on the air that she owns a medical marijuana business and was quitting her job to advocate for the drug.

item.title: Ukraine troops prepare pullback as truce holds
item.description: A fragile truce between pro-Russian insurgents and Ukrainian forces appeared to be consolidate on Monday as clashes subsided and attention focused on the unresolved status of the separatist east.

item.title: Iraq PM opposes foreign ground forces in Iraq
item.description: Iraqi Prime Minister Haidar al-Abadi opposes the deployment of foreign ground forces in Iraq as part of efforts to combat jihadists, his office said.

item.title: 1,30,000 Syrian refugees reach Turkey fleeing IS
item.description: The number of Syrian refugees who have reached Turkey in the past four days after fleeing the advance of Islamic State militants now totals 1,30,000.
